description: MaaS Booking schema (what we give out to mobile clients)

bookingCore.description: The basic booking, not containing leg or customer info

id.description: The id that MaaS uses for the booking

tspId.description: The id that a TSP uses for the booking

meta.description: Arbitrary metadata that a TSP can add

newBooking.description: A new booking, created by MaaS POST request in 'new' state

state.description: The state of the booking (always 'NEW' for new bookings)

booking.description: The booking information describing the state and details of the transaction

bookingState.description: The life-cycle state of the booking

token.description: The validity token (such as booking ID, travel ticket etc.) that MaaS clients will display to validate the trip when starting the leg.

validityDuration.description: The rules that MaaS will interpret to schedule, re-validate or cancel the booking.

from.description: The starting time from which the ticket is valid

to.description: The finishing time the ticket is valid for

meta.description: Arbitrary metadata the TSP may pass along the ticket to the client (e.g. a booking code, base64 encoded binary)

id.description: The identifier MaaS uses to identify the customer

firstName.description: First name of the customer (e.g. John)

lastName.description: Last name of the customer (e.g. Doe)

phone.description: Phone number that the customer may be reached from
